body: How bittersweet it is, on winter's night,To watch me watch drowned snow lift from the lake.Mère and Père Chose are walking away from theThat only you and I can know. Les deuxAgainst which we have been projected? What . . .The mortal architect had brought to life,A kind of snow, which hesitatesIt is as though I were at a second threshold.For any part of them we can make outDeep in the fog that quenches every ray,giddy as good kids playing hookey. Now,Silence, are in his hand—birds in a snare;The line between the outside and this roomBronze the sky, with noThe bees are buzzing,Right, and appears from here to be overcomePreface to the 1948 EditionThat square—Oh, 56 x 56Wheel tracks entrench themselves in snow, yet painted
